result.execSummary:
The defendant John Charles Talaska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Provide a DNA sample.
As a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. May not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: For use at the discretion of the agent. Condition time can be at the day reporting center if deemed appropriate by the department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Charles Talaska

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Charles Talaska in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 6 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time for use at the discretion of the agent.  Condition time can be at the day reporting center if deemed appropriate by the department.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
PSI Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

15RM035121  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-28-2015
All previous conditions as to bail to remain the same.

Defendant John Charles Talaska in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for David Behm for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on 8/24/15 in Branch 22.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant John Charles Talaska in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered a Presentence Report WITHOUT recommendation at the defense request. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 8/24/2015 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant John Charles Talaska not in court, in custody. Karl Hayes for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is in a treatment program at MSDF. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/29/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant John Charles Talaska not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant will be doing a drug program at MSDF. Case calendared for STATUS on 3/31/2015 at 3:00 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant John Charles Talaska in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant John Charles Talaska in custody.  Ron Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Charles Talaska in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant John Charles Talaska in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
